physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Presented with hypertension and diarrhea. CT scan revealed a 4.4 cm retroperitoneal mass.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: In 2010, the patient developed recurrent hypertension and abdominal pain; symptoms and elevated catecholamines were reported.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Norepinephrine 2770 mg/24 h (nl 0 to 140 mg/24 h), Dopamine 3083 mg/24 h (nl 65 to 610 mg/24 h), Epinephrine 7 mg/24 h (nl 0 to 32 mg/24 h).
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: CT scan revealed lytic lesions in the first lumbar vertebral body and right iliac crest, as well as new retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Hypertension improved with beginning treatment with prazosin and labetalol.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Received external beam radiation and various antineoplastic agents without success in preventing disease progression.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The disease progressed despite treatment, and the patient expired in 2012.
